fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36991].
  {panel}

h3. *Steps to Reproduce* 
# Created a new page 
# Created a table, insert a long word in the table 
# Save the page 
# Export to PDF 

h3. *Expected Behaviour* 
Should be able to export the page to PDF without cut off 

h3. *Actual Behaviour* 
Table gets cut off on PDF Export if table has long word.

!cutoff.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Long word in a table is resulting to right part of the table cutoff on PDF Export
#parse('child-template.vm') does not render values HTML escaped
In line comments are great, but if they are to fail due to some surrounding macros, user needs to be warned BEFORE they enter the text, not when they go to save.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36985].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
When using the Roadmap Planner macro, if the name of the row is larger than the row itself (for example if the row has one bar but the name is "Requirements") the name will be shortened. See the following image:
!Roadmap macro.PNG|thumbnail!

The rows already scale in height based on the number of bars in the row.

h4. Solution
Either allow the row height to automatically scale to the length of the name, or allow users to be able to resize the height of the row manually.
fields.summary: Allow Roadmap Planner rows height to be resized

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36961].
  {panel}

h3. ***Steps to reproduce***
# Create a table in Confluence
# Add a double spacing
# Save
# Edit in IE or Firefox (remove additional spacing)
# Save
# The spacing is not removed

(i) Tested in IE11 and Firefox v36

h3. ***Workaround***
The feature seems to work fine in Chrome
fields.summary: Edit Spacing in Tables does not work in Firefox and IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36958].
  {panel}

Hi guys,

Are there any plans for versioning comments on attachments?  I've seen some tickets for versioning comments in general but I don't know if you guys consider those to be one and the same.

Thanks.

Tim
fields.summary: Version comments on attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36956].

*Atlassian Update: December 11, 2020*

Hi Confluence Cloud customers,

Thank you for your ongoing engagement and feedback on this feature request. I’m excited to announce that inline comments in edit mode is now *live to 100% of customers*. You can now create, view, and resolve inline comments whether you are viewing or editing a page. We hope this new feature helps you and your team collaborate more effectively in Confluence Cloud. To learn more about the new feature check out our community post here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Inline-comments-while-editing-FINALLY/ba-p/1444781]

Best,
 Daniel Ayele
 Product Manager, Confluence Cloud

 
{panel}
At the moment the inline comments feature is only visible when viewing a page. This issue is to track customers requests for viewing it while editing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36943].
  {panel}

I have previously used com.atlassian.confluence.util.ExcerptHelper class in Confluence to create page exceprts based on "excerpt" macro.

For some time now this stopped being possible via IoC injection. 

There are still [Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/109112/get-value-from-excerpt-macro-in-a-page-confluence-4.3] and [developer-to-developer discussions|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/hipchat-for-confluence/pull-request/5/add-tl-dr-from-new-blog-posts-to-hipchat/diff] around for older code base that it should be possible to use the class, but it seems to not be possible to have this class injected anymore.

Atlassian's own code seems to be able to [have it injected|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/confluence-advanced-macros-plugin/src/0ba9e7b4f4815cc91d705b8a8a086542bddd9f56/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/xhtml/ExcerptIncludeMacro.java?at=master#cl-154], but not plugins.

During upgrade of one of our plugins to support 5.7 I was forced to replicate the code of ExcerptHelper in our own project, with changes since not all classes that relies on are available to plugins either. 

I do see in another [Answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/240777] a piece of "normal" IoC setter code commented out in favor of lazy initialization via direct call to ContainerManager.getComponent("excerptHelper"). Not sure if it works in 5.7 as the date on the post is 2013.

Does it have to be this hard? Can ExcerptHelper be marked as available for plugins in rederingContext.xml or something similar to [CONF-22371|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22371] magic be done?

I also note that often when a consumer of API like us wants an excerpt from a page developers will have to repeat the same pattern - use ExcerptHelper to extract "excerpt" macro content and if there is none, use something like com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.view.excerpt.Excerpter (perfectly injectable) to fall back to another method - so perhaps it would be nice to supply an injectable helper class with aggregated functionality?
fields.summary: Make ExcerptHelper injectable into add-ons code (again?)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36933].
  {panel}

Inline comments need some improvements.  Currently, there is no way to tell if a page has any inline comments just by looking at the top of the page.  A user has to visually scan the page and try to see if there is any highlighting indicating an inline comment.  This is hard to do and undesirable for several reasons:

# The page may be dense or very busy,
# the highlighting used is faint and hard to see on many monitors we tested,
# the can take a long time to do on long pages without any guarantee of success and the effort may be wasted if there are no comments.

Also, there is no way to open the inline comment browser except for finding an inline comment and clicking on it.  We request the following features:

# Display a count of the inline comments at the top of the page.
# Provide a link / menu option / keyboard shortcut to view the inline comments when you are not currently viewing any inline comments.
## If the count of inline comments is > 0, then the count could be a link that, when clicked, opens the right-side sidebar to view and navigate inline comments for the page.
## Hitting ] should toggle the right-side inline comment navigator.
fields.summary: Improve Inline Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36930].
  {panel}

[Release notes for Confluence 5.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes#Confluence5.7ReleaseNotes-Smallimprovementswithabigimpact] say that "The editor 'Cancel' button will now say 'Close' and, the best part is, it'll save a draft of your page just in case you didn't mean to close the editor." 

However it appears that clicking Close does not save a new draft, it merely retains the last autosaved draft. So you can still lose changes that were made after the last autosave. 

It would be great if clicking Close triggered an autosave, so that nothing is lost. 

Workaround: Wait for an autosave after your last change, or click Preview before Close (Preview forces an autosave, however note [CONF-36410|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36410]). Of course this isn't very helpful because it relies on the user anticipating problems and intentionally closing without saving, rather than doing it accidentally, which may be the more common case. 

To reproduce:
* edit a page and make a change
* click Close before the change is autosaved
* go to Drafts and see that the change is not there
* edit the page again and make a change
* sit on the page until an autosave occurs, then click Close
* go to Drafts and see that the change is there
fields.summary: Save a new draft on Close

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36920].
  {panel}

1. Create a page with text "there the there the there".
2. Highlight the first occurrence of " the " (with spaces included)
3. Try to create Inline Comment

The insert should fail. The reason is that the data sent from the client to the server (check the AJAX request) will list " the " as the first match, but will trim the originalSelection text to be only "the". Technically, the first occurrence of "the" is in the first "there" and the matching algorithm gets confused and fails.
fields.summary: Can't find an occurrence of text when creating inline comment

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36914].
  {panel}

My requirement is , when a person creates a space, confluence should automatically check the user group where he belongs and automatically open the space only to that group.Is it possible?

Here's an example of a scenario that explain this feature:
# There is a user (USERA) with the following group membership
#* Creative
#* Technical
#* Awesome
#* Smart
# The USERA is constantly require to create spaces that are view-able by this four group only due to his job scope.
# There is another user (USERB) with the following group membership
#* High
#* Low
#* North
#* South
# Similarly, USERB is constantly require to create spaces that are view-able by this four group which he has membership in.

For now, the only option for them is to assign those group into the space permission after the space is created. This can be a tedious task and time consuming. 

It would be convenient if there is an option that allow the user to assign their group into the space permission during the creation of the spaces.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36899].
  {panel}

In Confluence 5.7 and later version, we have the bundled *Confluence Previews* add-on, which is responsible for creating the preview for the attachments in the instance. 

By disabling this add-on, Confluence will not provide the option to preview any file and instead of it, for attachments like PDF, Word, Excel, it will download the file. However, for the images, no option will be provided. Neither to download it or to preview. 

This is a feature request to provide an option (or a new module in the add-on) to disable the preview only for specific attachments such as Word, PDF, Excel and the images will still be able to be previewed.

PS: We do have options to disable only the preview for PDF with the following modules:

*Confluence Previews PDF webworker resource(confluence-previews-pdf-worker)*
*Confluence Previews Resources for pdf viewer(confluence-previews-pdf)*

However, both will make the preview be displayed, but, the PDF file will keep loading and will not display the file at all, which is not the same behaviour as requested in this one.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of June 27, 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Thanks for your suggestions and feedback on this issue. After reviewing the comments, the majority of issues are caused by a [bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36899] in the preview functionality in Confluence Server offering and not the Confluence Cloud offering.

In light of this, we will not support the capability to optionally disable file preview for Confluence Cloud.

Alice Wang
Senior Development Team Lead, Confluence Cloud
{panel}
fields.summary: Option to Disable Preview of Specific Attachments (PDF, Excel, Word)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36885].
  {panel}

I really love the global "g then x" pattern to navigate around Confluence. I get quite a lot of use out of g+g or / to open quick search, and g+d is useful for getting to the dashboard, but after using these a bit, I found myself expecting there to be a shortcut for navigating directly to the homepage of a targeted space.

In other words, I envision:
* g then (p) - opens a space picker dialog
* type the first few characters of the desired space to filter the list
* hit enter once the desired space is highlighted; browser navigates to that space

At present, you can sort of do this with the quick search, but you will have to type more characters to filter the list properly, and will still have to hit the down arrow a couple of times to pass over the list of pages down to the space results. A dedicated shortcut and picker would be much better for this.

I'm not sure what key should be used for this -- my expectation was that g+s would fit the best, and "browse current" would be set to g+c or something. But that's not the important part!

Currently the date picker  macro uses the dd-mm-yyyy:
!date.png|thumbnail!

If you configure confluence to use a different time format, like mm-dd-yyyy, the macro will still uses the dd-mm-yyyy.

I know that if we manually select the date you want the macro will works fine, however if you are used to type you will write the date you want instead of selecting you will end up writing a wrong date since you are used to a different format.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36850].
  {panel}

We have begun using tasks extensively in our Confluence instance (especially in meeting notes!).

When a user marks a task complete, all watchers receive a notification. This is good, and expected functionality.

The issue is that the notification sent (at least in 5.6.3) is rather unclear about which exact task was marked complete. The notification shows the entire list of tasks, with some very subtle formatting showing the one task marked complete. 

When there are many tasks on a list, some checked and some unchecked, it can become very confusing to know which task has been marked complete.

For example, see the attached PDF - one of the tasks was marked complete, which one was it? (Hint, it's on page 3).

Ideally, the formatting in the notification email would be much more visible for task marked completed, or alternatively the tasks marked complete would be the only tasks showing (although I do like seeing the entire list as it motivates other users to close their tasks...!).
fields.summary: Confluence task marked complete notifcation emails should be clearer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36799].
  {panel}

We LOVE The Macro but it can make your Confluence Page Ugly!

*Background*
Teams who collect formal requirements and need to provide Change management need to be able to track the individual change of requirements.   to meet this requirement, we are creating requirements in JIRA and inserting them in Confluence to provide the big picture. 

For example, we have issues type for User Action, System Action, System Response and business Rules.  we use these issue types to create the traditional Use Case requirements for compliance.  Opposed to having text published in confluence the  document is made up of JIRA issues inserted into the table.   Teams complain that the issue ID and Status are distracting and the table view adds an unnecessary header.

*Acceptance Criteria* 
# When viewing a List of Issues, Allow the Table Header to be Hidden
# When Viewing an individual issue, allow the all issue attributes to be hidden. 
## Text would appear like inline comments 
## Hovering over would show the issue details.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Issues Macro Formatting Options
